snippet: The body of Bones, once suspected of killing a man, was identified after being buried in the backyard of his owner’s former home.
abstract: Body of missing dog, released to an animal advocacy group after being cleared of any connection to the murder of a man in Manhattan in 2011, is found buried in backyard of Toledo, Ohio resident who had adopted the animal from Lexus Project on Long Island; Kathy Sutter claims dog was stolen from her home but Toledo Area Humane Society official says local prosecutors have become involved based on condition of corpse.
lead_paragraph: The body of Bones, once suspected of killing a man, was identified after being buried in the backyard of his owner’s former home.

headline.main: Unlucky in Owners, a Dog Cleared in a Manhattan Killing Is Found Dead in Ohio
headline.print_headline: Unlucky in Owners, a Dog Cleared in a Manhattan Killing Is Found Dead in Ohio
